name: Defintions
body:
### Welcome to Bullshit definition Pages.

To understand what a Rhesus of Idempotency Homoiconosity means we must first delve into the etymology of it's prospecting words.

Rhesus - [Rhesus](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhesus_%28play%29) (Greek: Ῥῆσος, Rhēsos) is an Athenian tragedy that belongs to the transmitted plays of Euripides.

Idempotency - [Idempotence](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idempotence) (/ˌaɪdɨmˈpoʊtəns/ EYE-dəm-POH-təns) is the property of certain operations in mathematics and computer science, that can be applied multiple times without changing the result beyond the initial application

Homoiconosity - A mispelling of [Homoiconocity](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homoiconicity).

With that in mind, it's obvious that Rhesus Idempotency of Homoiconosity represent the classical definition of Tragedy on the transformative art of interactive simulation. It stands in stark contrast to definition of [Thauma](http://www.whatgamesare.com/thauma.html), which is defined as the sense of marvel and wonder that is acquired by gazing into the receptacle of the interactive simulator.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
